content: The new white border between Send and â‹® (#25313) looks out of place in dark mode.

Yeah, I feel it looks a bit off, but I'm not sure what to do with that divider. The button itself has the same white-on-purple style in both the light and dark themes; I don't think making that divider dark would work from a contrast standpoint.

I think maybe the best idea I have is that perhaps the divider shouldn't be the full height of the button; that looks nice in the light theme since it connects with the whitespace around it, but doesn't in the dark theme?

The redesign approach (cf. #24878) is to put the three-dot menu on the overall compose box background, rather than on the purple background. Should we try that?

Screen-Shot-2023-05-01-at-1.07.58-PM.png
3 messages were moved here from #frontend > send-button padding by Alya Abbott.

Hmm. I think given that the only thing you can do with this menu is send the message in a delayed fashion, I feel like it having the same colored styling as the "Send" button is helpful. That's one of the riskier details of the proposed compose box redesign, and it comes with moving the "Enter Sends" menu into that menu.
So I think it's much lower risk to just make the white separator less tall if we want to just get something satisfactory.
